required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Foot Plantar Pressure Changes After Plantar Dry Needling
clinical_study.official_title: Standing Plantar Pressure Changes After Plantar Dry Needling in Flexor Digitorum Brevis

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this clinical trial is to check the effects of dry needling in the Flexor digitorum Brevis.
Twenty healthy subjects wil be recruited for a quasi-experimental study. Participants will be from 18 to 40 years old, not obese. Participants will be measured before and after bilateral dry neddling in Flexor digitorum Brevis. The investigators will measure static footprint variables. The footprint variables will be divided in bilateral rear foot, bilateral midfoot, bilateral fore foot.

primary_outcome.measure: Variables of plantar pressures with platform before dry puncture
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 week
primary_outcome.description: During 30 seconds we will record the plantar pressure variables in grams per square centimeter.

primary_outcome.measure: Variable footprint plantar surface with platform before dry puncture
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 week
primary_outcome.description: For 30 seconds we will record the area of the footprint in square centimeters.

primary_outcome.measure: Variables of plantar pressures with platform after dry puncture
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 week
primary_outcome.description: During 30 seconds we will record the plantar pressure variables in grams per square centimeter.

primary_outcome.measure: Variable footprint plantar surface with platform after dry puncture
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 week
primary_outcome.description: For 30 seconds we will record the area of the footprint in square centimeters.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Bilateral dry needling in Flexor Brevis Digitorum in subjects with latent trigger point
arm_group.description: Bilateral dry needling in Flexor Brevis Digitorum in subjects with latent trigger point

intervention.description: The static footprint will measure the plantar pressures and surface area of the back of the foot, midfoot and forefoot. Subjects were instructed to stand barefoot on the force platform, participants were instructed to remain in a relaxed standing posture with feet shoulder-width apart and positioned 30 degrees from the midline.
intervention.arm_group_label: Bilateral dry needling in Flexor Brevis Digitorum in subjects with latent trigger point

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Flat foot grade II or II with
- Must have latent trigger point in Flexor Brevis Digitorum muscles
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous lower extremities surgery.
- History of lower extremities injury with residual symptoms (pain, "giving-away" sensations) within the last year.
- Leg-length discrepancy more than 1 cm

responsible_party.investigator_title: Head of Podiatry, Principal Investigator, and Physiotherapist
